@Google 4/ This makes it difficult to keep the botnet offline: “The Glupteba botnet cannot be eradicated entirely without neutralizing its blockchain-based infrastructure,” Google said.

@Google 3/ The botnet uses the Bitcoin blockchain to stay online. If a command-and-control server is for the botnet is taken down by authorities, it moves to a new server based on information embedded in on the Bitcoin blockchain.

#EIP3541 makes it impossible for new contracts starting with 0xEF to be deployed. The change is another step towards improving the Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM).

British luxury fashion brand @Burberry has dropped its first collection of non-fungible tokens (NFTs), including one featuring Sharky B. 

By @Tanzeel_Akhtar 
https://t.co/2wHtkuzdWD

#EIP3198 is a simple code change that allows smart contracts to access the base fee of a given block. This ensures that decentralized applications on Ethereum can trustlessly interact with the base fee value and possibly create gas price derivatives tokens.

#EIP3529 is titled 'A Reduction In Refunds'. The proposal was motivated by the increasing misuse of gas tokens on Ethereum bloating the network's state size. Furthermore, the EIP aims to reduce current block size variance.

#EIP3554 aims to delay Ethereum’s "difficulty bomb" which gradually increases the mining difficulty for block production on the network. The bomb will be delayed until December, at which point developers anticipate Ethereum will be ready to transition to proof-of-stake.

#EIP1559 is the most talked about piece of the London upgrade and rightfully so. This proposal will alter Ethereum's fee market so that ETH spent on minimum transaction fees will get removed from circulation instead of being awarded to miners.
https://t.co/8SamNnHddU

COUNTDOWN TO LONDON: In less than 24 hours, the London hard fork upgrade is going live on #Ethereum. It contains 5 code changes including Ethereum's fee market change dubbed EIP 1559, as well as 4 additional Ethereum Improvement Proposals.

BT made the surprise announcement on NFT All Stars at #Consensus2021 this morning alongside @MetaKovan and @WhaleShark_Pro
It's composed of 15 separate pieces of music that might be considered one long song. Each piece – like an Indian raag – is programmed to play at a specific time of day,  @BT told CoinDesk.
"I had the pleasure of previewing @BT's piece and was blown away by the amount of thought and integration that art, sound and technology were integrated within the masterpiece," @WhaleShark_Pro said.
BT is known for working with artists like @NSYNC, @Madonna and @toriamos to push the boundaries of music production. Now he's pushing the technical boundaries in crypto.
The 1-of-1 work features almost 15,000 hard-sequenced musical and visual events that will play over a 24-hour period.
Today, at #Consensus2021, the Grammy-nominated trance pioneer unveiled what could be considered the most technologically complex NFT to date.
